page.title: 05The Crown Hotel, Bawtry
page.content: The Crown Hotel is a white building with black woodwork which stands in Bawtry Market Square.An arch on the right leads to the sleeping accommodation and bars.The kitchens also open onto this long,narrow court- yard.There is a car park at the back of the hotel and behind the bedrooms can be seen remains of the stables. The ballroom is known as the Hogarth Room and its walls are lined with amusing and serious Victorian pictures.Beautiful chandeliers hang from the ceiling. A door from this room leads to a small ,pretty garden.There are big wooden benches and an island flower bed.It is enclosed by a wall and is quiet and private.The Crown Hotel was once a Posting House and has associations with Robin Hood and Dick Turpin.
